instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2141: What is A2141? A2141 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3347, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01700..
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V8_SLPS2R: What is PP1V8_SLPS2R? PP1V8_SLPS2R is a 1.8v power rail present when the system is in a SLPS2R state. .
definitions.PP2V5_NAND_SSD0: What is PP2V5_NAND_SSD0? PP2V5_NAND_SSD0 This is a power rail that powers the NAND on Macbooks where the solid state drive is soldered directly to the board. .
definitions.PP1V1_SLPS2R: What is PP1V1_SLPS2R? The PP1V1_SLPS2R power rail in the MacBook schematic provides a 1.1-volt supply in a specific low-power state indicated by the "_SLPS2R" suffix and is used for powering the T2 chip..
definitions.PP2V5_NAND_SSD1: What is PP2V5_NAND_SSD1? PP2V5_NAND_SSD1 is a power rail that powers the soldered on SSDs.
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.
definitions.PP3V3_G3S: What is PP3V3_G3S? PP3V3_G3S is a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in a G3S standby state. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 5V 250 milliamps
threads.message:
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> came in taking 5v, 200-250 milliamps...
I've taken some measurements and found <SIGNAL>PP3V3G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> reading a little lower than expected in diode mode.. I looked in the the thermal camera and found <CHIP>U6960</CHIP> (<SIGNAL>PP3V3G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> VR) to be heating up.. I replaced it.
Board still taking 5v 200-250 milliamps.. I've taken another look into the thermal camera and found a USB-C controller (<CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>) one of them is heating up.. I replaced it..
Still 5v 200-250 milliamps.. taken another look at the thermal cam and now it's T2 heating up
I've put the board into its housing and put the computer in DFU and entered successfully, tried reviving the computer and its not showing any signs of life whatsoever.. giving me error "4042"
Is there anything else I can look into it?
Can it be a problem with the <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> Calpe PMU? Can it be an issue with the T2 itself? I'm more than happy to troubleshoot it but never given the shot to dive deep.. I'm not sure on which rails should be present too.

edit: one hint *might* help is that the trackpad does not click, usually when those computer in a certain state the trackpad clicks but does not show life.. this one does not show signs of life or clicking trackpad.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 5V 250 milliamps
threads.message:
The SLPS2R and AWAKE volatges are stable?
Check on the small coils around <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>.

Also compare diode mode readings on the big coils with good board.
If not available, use reference table:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://openboarddata.org/?a=showboardsolutions&bpath=laptops/apple/<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>[/URL]
Don't forget L9080/580.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 5V 250 milliamps
threads.message:
Any G3S voltage present?

Did you test with original 96/140W charger?

Many times revive doesn't help.
I saw several cases when restore fixed problems, instead of revive.
Be aware, restore erase SSD; confirm this with the client first.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 5V 250 milliamps
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> not present 
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3S</SIGNAL> not present 
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_G3S</SIGNAL> not present 

I'm sorry, what does that mean? "G3S" status not being present? 

And yes I use 96W genuine. 

I will see the customer if he's OK with erase.
